item.title: Jodi add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "I'd been willing to kill for the people I loved for a very long time; now I had to start living for them." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Still it might be nice, once in a while, not to have to choose between evils. Just once, couldn't I choose the lesser good?" -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Maybe they know what I know, that the true way to a man's heart is six inches of metal between his ribs. Sometimes four inches will do the job, but to be really sure, I like to have six." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Friends don't count the cost of favors." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Jodi add a quote by P.C. Cast
item.description: "You know how it is with cats: They don't really have owners, they have staff." -- P.C. Cast

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "There comes a point when you either embrace who and what you are, or condemn yourself to be miserable all your days. Other people will try to make you miserable; don't help them by doing the job yourself." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Patricia Briggs
item.description: "Never trust a mechanic who drives new cars. They're either charging too much money for their work, or they can't keep an old car running - maybe both." -- Patricia Briggs

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description:
"I suspect it may be like the difference between a drinker and an alcoholic; the one merely reads books, the other needs books to make it through the day."
(Interview with <i>The Booklovers</i> blog, September 2010)" -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Does the walker choose the path, or the path the walker?" -- Garth Nix

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "Life is to be lived, not controlled; and humanity is won by continuing to play in face of certain defeat." -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "If you think anyone is sane you just don't know enough about them." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Jodi add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "You've got to get obsessed and stay obsessed." -- John Irving

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?" -- Edward Albee

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Google can bring you back 100,000 answers. A librarian can bring you back the right one." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Keri Hulme
item.description: "You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read..." -- Keri Hulme

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Jonathan Ames
item.description: "I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained." -- Jonathan Ames

item.title: Jodi add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion." -- Rumi
